headline: Micron’s Margin Pressure Overwhelms AI Boost
summary: Micron is getting a definite piece of the artificial-intelligence boom.  High-bandwidth memory, or HBM, that is used in AI systems designed by companies like Nvidia was a star performer, with quarterly sales exceeding $1 billion for the first time ever— surging more than 50% from just three months ago.  Micron caused additional concern by noting on its conference call that it expects gross margins to be “up somewhat” in the August-ending quarter—suggesting a shortfall to the three-point sequential gain analysts had been expecting.
